GOD.content: [economy of the sacrifice] in turn toward new mystery, toward new structure of responsibility, prior one never eliminated, kept w/in oneself, mourned as crypt of a more ancient secret > is this repression, is this a kind of sacrificial Aufhebung?
GOD.linkedContent: [economy of the sacrifice] in turn toward new mystery, toward new structure of responsibility, prior one never eliminated, kept w/in oneself, mourned as crypt of a more ancient secret > is this repression, is this a kind of sacrificial Aufhebung?

GOD.content: repression & incorporation: either 2 economies, or one economy w/ 2 systems in move from mysterium to secretum (possibility of keeping the secret)
GOD.linkedContent: repression & incorporation: either 2 economies, or one economy w/ 2 systems in move from mysterium to secretum (possibility of keeping the secret)

GOD.content: [secretum as history of truth, as cryptology, as a subjectification, separation from community of fusion]
GOD.linkedContent: [secretum as history of truth, as cryptology, as a subjectification, separation from community of fusion]

GOD.content: genealogy’s axiom: history never effaces what it buries (enfouit), keeps (garde) secret of what it encrypts, the secret of the secret, c’est une histoire secrète du secret gardé; genealogy is also an economy
GOD.linkedContent: genealogy’s axiom: history never effaces what it buries (enfouit), keeps (garde) secret of what it encrypts, the secret of the secret, c’est une histoire secrète du secret gardé; genealogy is also an economy

GOD.content: heart as light, photology, because it is spiritual, not earthly, it cannot hide, cannot be encrypted, an omnipresence more radical & effective than a spy satellite
GOD.linkedContent: heart as light, photology, because it is spiritual, not earthly, it cannot hide, cannot be encrypted, an omnipresence more radical & effective than a spy satellite

GOD.content: literature, place of secrets w/out secrecy, all these crypts w/out depth, no other basis than abyss of call or address; only law: singularity of event called the work (l’oeuvre)
GOD.linkedContent: literature, place of secrets w/out secrecy, all these crypts w/out depth, no other basis than abyss of call or address; only law: singularity of event called the work (l’oeuvre)

GT.content: readability of text structured by unreadability of secret, narrator in situation analogous to reader; crypt gives to be read, eternally unreadable
GT.linkedContent: readability of text structured by unreadability of secret, narrator in situation analogous to reader; crypt gives to be read, eternally unreadable

GT.content: [no depth beyond literary phenomenon] inviolability of secret depends on essential superficiality, bare device of being-two-to-speak (l’être-deux-à-parler), a secret beyond reserve of technique, thing, being, thing thought (same could be said for money)
GT.linkedContent: [no depth beyond literary phenomenon] inviolability of secret depends on essential superficiality, bare device of being-two-to-speak (l’être-deux-à-parler), a secret beyond reserve of technique, thing, being, thing thought (same could be said for money)

FK.content: crypt: n + 1 incalculably engenders all supplements

LOBL.content: je m’arrête > “same interdiction encrypts the resurrection at the moment when he sees the terrible Chose”
LOBL.linkedContent: je m’arrête > “same interdiction encrypts the resurrection at the moment when he sees the terrible Chose”

LOBL.content: absolute crypt [heart] is unreadability—yet calls for infinite finite analysis, infinite-finite reada-translata-bility
LOBL.linkedContent: absolute crypt [heart] is unreadability—yet calls for infinite finite analysis, infinite-finite reada-translata-bility
for intérieur (“conscience,” “inner tribunal,” “heart of hearts”), crypt

LOBL.content: Blanchot: “in the very heart of which lives the infinite”
LOBL.linkedContent: Blanchot: “in the very heart of which lives the infinite”

LOBL.content: “come”: single word, yet intertwined in series, inscribes its own effacement in middle of and on invaginated boundaries of récit, of these crypts, death or bridal chambers, hymen brings alliance & separation [after theft of key]
LOBL.linkedContent: “come”: single word, yet intertwined in series, inscribes its own effacement in middle of and on invaginated boundaries of récit, of these crypts, death or bridal chambers, hymen brings alliance & separation [after theft of key]

LOBL.content: in Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, 2 women, 2 voices w/out voice, tele-phone each other: “come” > how do we read this unreadable hymen? it takes place as unreadable, from bottom of crypt in which it remains > it will have taken place where it remains: that’s the proof
LOBL.linkedContent: in Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, 2 women, 2 voices w/out voice, tele-phone each other: “come” > how do we read this unreadable hymen? it takes place as unreadable, from bottom of crypt in which it remains > it will have taken place where it remains: that’s the proof

H.content: [on Oedipus’ final mourning] he’s deprived of something in secrecy [of light?], an encrypting of encrypting, in the crypt the address is cryptic
H.linkedContent: [on Oedipus’ final mourning] he’s deprived of something in secrecy [of light?], an encrypting of encrypting, in the crypt the address is cryptic

H.content: Oedipus is twice encrypted, 1st in dying, 2<sup><small>nd</small></sup> in hiding his death > by demanding he be kept dead, he announces a piece of blackmail
H.linkedContent: Oedipus is twice encrypted, 1st in dying, 2nd in hiding his death > by demanding he be kept dead, he announces a piece of blackmail

H.content: p. anne 114 crypt, vault [voute] has a relation to casting spells [envoutement]; pp. 124-26 having a spell cast is enclosure beneath a vault—dematerialization of Internet end of spell? no, there’s spell, encrypting in techno-communication
H.linkedContent: p. anne 114 crypt, vault [voute] has a relation to casting spells [envoutement]; pp. 124-26 having a spell cast is enclosure beneath a vault—dematerialization of Internet end of spell? no, there’s spell, encrypting in techno-communication

AF.content: repression dissimulates or encrypts the archives, archive of the virtual > virtuality removed from its oppositional coupling to actuality, effectivity, reality [re: full & effective actuality of an archived event]
AF.linkedContent: repression dissimulates or encrypts the archives, archive of the virtual > virtuality removed from its oppositional coupling to actuality, effectivity, reality [re: full & effective actuality of an archived event]

PP.content: written traces don’t belong to phusis, not alive, or belong to Heraclitean phusis, in which truth takes shelter in its crypt (à s’abriter en sa crypte) > “cryptogram” is a pleonasm
PP.linkedContent: written traces don’t belong to phusis, not alive, or belong to Heraclitean phusis, in which truth takes shelter in its crypt (à s’abriter en sa crypte) > “cryptogram” is a pleonasm

PP.content: acc. king, pharmakon hypnotizes life of memory, taking it out of itself (la faisant sortir de soi) by monumentalizing it: médusée (medusad)
PP.linkedContent: acc. king, pharmakon hypnotizes life of memory, taking it out of itself (la faisant sortir de soi) by monumentalizing it: médusée (medusad)

PP.content: in shadows of Plato’s pharmacy [like a crypt, cave], prior to oppositions (conscious/unconscious, freedom/constraint, voluntary/involuntary), where “language” is not pertinent
PP.linkedContent: in shadows of Plato’s pharmacy [like a crypt, cave], prior to oppositions (conscious/unconscious, freedom/constraint, voluntary/involuntary), where “language” is not pertinent

PAS.content: “terrifyingly ancient” time, absolute crypt, requires the récit (reciting, it can be a matter of nothing but that), ce récit [of viens], neither relation to the event nor event itself > pas d’événement, pas de concept
PAS.linkedContent: “terrifyingly ancient” time, absolute crypt, requires the récit (reciting, it can be a matter of nothing but that), ce récit [of viens], neither relation to the event nor event itself > pas d’événement, pas de concept

PPHS.content: Derrida, through Hegel, describes tomb, family crypt (caveau), oikēsis, as the sign of death that capitalizes (thésaurise) on life by marking that life continues elsewhere, il la tient donc aussi à l’abri de la mort; at the heart of this monument, this sign of death, soul keeps itself alive, needs this works of death > the sign, “the height conserving in its depths the hegemony of the soul,” is the pyramid [later, Derrida will live through this tomb not, like Hegel, by negating it]
PPHS.linkedContent: Derrida, through Hegel, describes tomb, family crypt (caveau), oikēsis, as the sign of death that capitalizes (thésaurise) on life by marking that life continues elsewhere, il la tient donc aussi à l’abri de la mort; at the heart of this monument, this sign of death, soul keeps itself alive, needs this works of death > the sign, “the height conserving in its depths the hegemony of the soul,” is the pyramid [later, Derrida will live through this tomb not, like Hegel, by negating it]

T.content: how to interpret (interpretation as neither a theory nor discursive practice of philosophy) the discourse that organizes economy of its [philosophy’s] representation, its weave, so nothing surprises: reasons from w/in vault (cave) of its autism
T.linkedContent: how to interpret (interpretation as neither a theory nor discursive practice of philosophy) the discourse that organizes economy of its [philosophy’s] representation, its weave, so nothing surprises: reasons from w/in vault (cave) of its autism

T.content: interpretation as luxating philosophical ear, set loxōs in logos to work, une tout autre forme d’embuscade, lokhos, block correspondence muffling other hammer [speaks to him w/ third ear]
T.linkedContent: interpretation as luxating philosophical ear, set loxōs in logos to work, une tout autre forme d’embuscade, lokhos, block correspondence muffling other hammer [speaks to him w/ third ear]

T.content: p. leiris xxi-ii basse taille: gravedigger’s funeral voice: monk
T.linkedContent: p. leiris xxi-ii basse taille: gravedigger’s funeral voice: monk

SH.content: crypt occurs, is poet’s passion (not action)
a date fascinates, but is not made to fascinate, crypt occurs wherever singular incision marks language (not the work of hermetic poet anxious to seduce w/ ciphers)
SH.linkedContent: a date fascinates, but is not made to fascinate, crypt occurs wherever singular incision marks language (not the work of hermetic poet anxious to seduce w/ ciphers)

F.content: the crypt’s rightful place is the other’s, it won’t have taken place
F.linkedContent: the crypt’s rightful place is the other’s, it won’t have taken place

F.content: je m’arrête ici, déjà (tombe en arrêt [vault to a stop]), setting on the “edge of the crypt” a voiceless word, a blank stone of a scruple [see p. xlviii], to engage others to it, of a crypt
F.linkedContent: je m’arrête ici, déjà (tombe en arrêt [vault to a stop]), setting on the “edge of the crypt” a voiceless word, a blank stone of a scruple [see p. xlviii], to engage others to it, of a crypt

F.content: question of crypt (singular not general) precedes philosophical questions re: Thing, Thinking > false, “artificial” unconscious (new metaphorical terrain): graft in heart of the organ
F.linkedContent: question of crypt (singular not general) precedes philosophical questions re: Thing, Thinking > false, “artificial” unconscious (new metaphorical terrain): graft in heart of the organ

F.content: crypt’s same: topoi, death, cipher > neither disassociated nor hierarchically ordered
F.linkedContent: crypt’s same: topoi, death, cipher > neither disassociated nor hierarchically ordered

F.content: crypt: hides as it holds, dissimulates its dissimulation, its grounds not natural; physis tends to encrypt (itself) > c’est qu’elle se déborde pour enfermer, naturellement, son autre, tous ses autres
F.linkedContent: crypt: hides as it holds, dissimulates its dissimulation, its grounds not natural; physis tends to encrypt (itself) > c’est qu’elle se déborde pour enfermer, naturellement, son autre, tous ses autres

F.content: an enclosure, history of an enclave, architecture, open square w/in space, secret interior w/in public square, a closure, a safe (for) in a forum (where free circulation of objects & speech occurs)
F.linkedContent: an enclosure, history of an enclave, architecture, open square w/in space, secret interior w/in public square, a closure, a safe (for) in a forum (where free circulation of objects & speech occurs)

F.content: hermetically sealed? yes and no [see SH p. 61], “je” ne sauve un for intérieur qu’en le mettant en “moi”, à part moi, dehors
F.linkedContent: hermetically sealed? yes and no [see SH p. 61], “je” ne sauve un for intérieur qu’en le mettant en “moi”, à part moi, dehors

F.content: crypt built by (dans) violence, break in w/ lock, force, discovering crack, choose angle
F.linkedContent: crypt built by (dans) violence, break in w/ lock, force, discovering crack, choose angle

F.content: crypt’s failure to prevent seeping, its angular inscriptions run along a divided line of “fantasmatic double(ness)”: each fantasy “double and opposed”
F.linkedContent: crypt’s failure to prevent seeping, its angular inscriptions run along a divided line of “fantasmatic double(ness)”: each fantasy “double and opposed”

F.content: le for du dedans (not intérieur) is not le tribunal de la conscience, even though enclosed w/in forum of self > it is the contradiction w/ in desire [?]: father’s penis neither comes [ne jouisse] nor goes [ni ne périsse] > from this contradiction we understand the solidity of crypt, the indefatigable effort to maintain it, & its failures, permeations from w/in & w/out, its seepings
F.linkedContent: le for du dedans (not intérieur) is not le tribunal de la conscience, even though enclosed w/in forum of self > it is the contradiction w/ in desire [?]: father’s penis neither comes [ne jouisse] nor goes [ni ne périsse] > from this contradiction we understand the solidity of crypt, the indefatigable effort to maintain it, & its failures, permeations from w/in & w/out, its seepings

F.content: crypt is a parasite inclusion/internalization, an inside heterogenous to inside of Self, an outcast in domain of introjection w/in which it violently takes its place, le for cryptique entretiens dans la répétition the mortal conflict it is impotent to resolve
F.linkedContent: crypt is a parasite inclusion/internalization, an inside heterogenous to inside of Self, an outcast in domain of introjection w/in which it violently takes its place, le for cryptique entretiens dans la répétition the mortal conflict it is impotent to resolve

F.content: crypt, place of silence, where a foreign body is kept as a foreigner, the self mimes introj. while incorp. makes secret; introjection speaks, incorporation silent, or speaks to ward off
F.linkedContent: crypt, place of silence, where a foreign body is kept as a foreigner, the self mimes introj. while incorp. makes secret; introjection speaks, incorporation silent, or speaks to ward off

F.content: crypt is monument/tomb/commemoration of object’s exclusion
F.linkedContent: crypt is monument/tomb/commemoration of object’s exclusion

F.content: crypt is vault (le caveau) of a desire [refused introjection: failed/fake incorporation]
F.linkedContent: crypt is vault (le caveau) of a desire [refused introjection: failed/fake incorporation]

F.content: crypt must always incorporate more than one, plus d’un: cryptophore’s secret must be shared (partagé) w/ a “third,” that’s what makes a secret a secret
F.linkedContent: crypt must always incorporate more than one, plus d’un: cryptophore’s secret must be shared (partagé) w/ a “third,” that’s what makes a secret a secret

F.content: le tiers incorporé est gardé pour être supprimé [held in to be crossed out]: assembly of witnesses around Wolf Man’s crypt (forum): whole strategy of testifying > on s’y coupe tout le temps, witnesses testify by interrupting, wounded by angular edges of forum
F.linkedContent: le tiers incorporé est gardé pour être supprimé [held in to be crossed out]: assembly of witnesses around Wolf Man’s crypt (forum): whole strategy of testifying > on s’y coupe tout le temps, witnesses testify by interrupting, wounded by angular edges of forum

F.content: crypt, pocket of resistance, le for le plus intérieur (la crypte comme inconscience artificiel, comme artefact du Moi) devient le hormis (excepté, sauf, fors) > dizzying topology of inside/outside
F.linkedContent: crypt, pocket of resistance, le for le plus intérieur (la crypte comme inconscience artificiel, comme artefact du Moi) devient le hormis (excepté, sauf, fors) > dizzying topology of inside/outside

F.content: [angular] partitions [w/in Self] of crypt: fractures into angular pieces, arranges (aménage) cavities, corridors, zigzag labyrinths, anfractuosities, craggy (escarpées) fortifications > effects of breakages (cassures); requires light in darkness to shine on inner partition of splintered symbol (intrasymbolic not cosymbolic): each fragment conscious to itself, unconscious to ‘non-crypt’
F.linkedContent: [angular] partitions [w/in Self] of crypt: fractures into angular pieces, arranges (aménage) cavities, corridors, zigzag labyrinths, anfractuosities, craggy (escarpées) fortifications > effects of breakages (cassures); requires light in darkness to shine on inner partition of splintered symbol (intrasymbolic not cosymbolic): each fragment conscious to itself, unconscious to ‘non-crypt’

F.content: crypt: no-place of place (other place), a before acquittal (the whole trial should no have ever been); crypt: “pleasure’s death” marks singular pleasure: fors
F.linkedContent: crypt: no-place of place (other place), a before acquittal (the whole trial should no have ever been); crypt: “pleasure’s death” marks singular pleasure: fors

F.content: crypt is catastrophe, catastrophe’s monument (forum is that which attempts to prevent catastrophe); but in trying to destroy it [crypt?], it is consolidated: this is the catastrophe
F.linkedContent: crypt is catastrophe, catastrophe’s monument (forum is that which attempts to prevent catastrophe); but in trying to destroy it [crypt?], it is consolidated: this is the catastrophe

F.content: [re: Wolf Man] choice btwn 2 catastrophes: 1) love his sister to avoid killing her 2) kill his sister to avoid loving her
F.linkedContent: [re: Wolf Man] choice btwn 2 catastrophes: 1) love his sister to avoid killing her 2) kill his sister to avoid loving her

F.content: Wolf Man tries to kill all the dead figures w/in him, and thus they are still alive > he silent consolidates the crypt
F.linkedContent: Wolf Man tries to kill all the dead figures w/in him, and thus they are still alive > he silent consolidates the crypt

F.content: crypt constructed by its very ruin, held up by what saps it > in its contradiction, coffre-fort [fors] and ceaseless instability
F.linkedContent: crypt constructed by its very ruin, held up by what saps it > in its contradiction, coffre-fort [fors] and ceaseless instability

F.content: crypt as commemorative monument of what must be kept alive: most precious think of all
F.linkedContent: crypt as commemorative monument of what must be kept alive: most precious think of all

F.content: the Thing is encrypted by crypt (for du Moi, self’s safe) not w/in (dans) it; crypted structure of ultimate referent [Thing] means double articulation (history, story) coalesces all these genres: myth, poem, novel, drama, translation > the narrated event never appears
F.linkedContent: the Thing is encrypted by crypt (for du Moi, self’s safe) not w/in (dans) it; crypted structure of ultimate referent [Thing] means double articulation (history, story) coalesces all these genres: myth, poem, novel, drama, translation > the narrated event never appears

F.content: Torok: “the discovery of English as a cryptic language was a crucial step”
F.linkedContent: Torok: “the discovery of English as a cryptic language was a crucial step”

F.content: crypt (foreigner in self) & the ghost effect (heterocryptic ghost returning from Unconscious of the other) > radical otherness in self (not unconscious) > law of another generation
F.linkedContent: crypt (foreigner in self) & the ghost effect (heterocryptic ghost returning from Unconscious of the other) > radical otherness in self (not unconscious) > law of another generation

F.content: ghost effect (ghost that comes haunting from someone else’s crypt, heterocryptography) ≠ crypt effect (foreigner incorporated in crypt of Self) > la revenance n’est pas un retour du refoulé ——“ventroliquist” speaks from topography w/in self or from foreign/parental topography
F.linkedContent: ghost effect (ghost that comes haunting from someone else’s crypt, heterocryptography) ≠ crypt effect (foreigner incorporated in crypt of Self) > la revenance n’est pas un retour du refoulé ——“ventroliquist” speaks from topography w/in self or from foreign/parental topography

F.content: tombstone is “illicit,” marks extreme jouissance, attempt to break in [analyze] isn’t illegal, a market is organized around crypt, when introjection is thwarted > evaluates rates (taux) of pleasure (jouissance) & pain (forum or for, la place de marché, fur)
F.linkedContent: tombstone is “illicit,” marks extreme jouissance, attempt to break in [analyze] isn’t illegal, a market is organized around crypt, when introjection is thwarted > evaluates rates (taux) of pleasure (jouissance) & pain (forum or for, la place de marché, fur)

F.content: melancholic crypt: shelters one’s own lost and incorporated object; Wolf Man’s crypt not melancholic, it shelters illegitimate object of another [his sister] [ghost effect?]
F.linkedContent: melancholic crypt: shelters one’s own lost and incorporated object; Wolf Man’s crypt not melancholic, it shelters illegitimate object of another [his sister] [ghost effect?]

F.content: crypt: 1) organization of places designed to lead astray 2) topos to conserve/hide living dead 3) cipher/code
F.linkedContent: crypt: 1) organization of places designed to lead astray 2) topos to conserve/hide living dead 3) cipher/code

F.content: self: a cemetery guard (crypt is enclosed w/in self as excluded), self makes rounds (round & round) of crypt like he’s the proprietor, but he’s not, uses knowledge to keep visitors away
F.linkedContent: self: a cemetery guard (crypt is enclosed w/in self as excluded), self makes rounds (round & round) of crypt like he’s the proprietor, but he’s not, uses knowledge to keep visitors away

F.content: machinery would attest to existence of crypt
F.linkedContent: machinery would attest to existence of crypt

DS.content: mimesis commanded by process of truth 1) mimēsis presents thing itself, the physis that produces itself, it is the movement of phusis (which prefers the crypt), is linked to mnēmē, which unveils, un-forgets

P.linkedContent: Kant’s disinterested pleasure (uninteressirten Wohlgefallen) a mise en crypte (a pleasing myself by putting to death what exists in as much as it exists)

REST.content: “clearly” & “evidently” do not implicate clarity but necessity to deny intrinsic obscurity of the thing—deny its essential crypt
REST.linkedContent: “clearly” & “evidently” do not implicate clarity but necessity to deny intrinsic obscurity of the thing—deny its essential crypt

REST.content: “useless hermeticism [Artaud]” of crypted remainder, secret already legible, separation already in the word, the letter, the pair > opening of secret
REST.linkedContent: “useless hermeticism [Artaud]” of crypted remainder, secret already legible, separation already in the word, the letter, the pair > opening of secret

EJQB.content: nonquestion, act of faith, unpenetrated certainty that Being is a Grammar, world is in all its parts a cryptogram [this nonquestion not yet a dogma]
EJQB.linkedContent: nonquestion, act of faith, unpenetrated certainty that Being is a Grammar, world is in all its parts a cryptogram [this nonquestion not yet a dogma]

PJP.content: tragedy of testimonial narration > encrypt while unveiling
PJP.linkedContent: tragedy of testimonial narration > encrypt while unveiling

C.content: Derrida means not to touch anything, leave the thing alone, alone w/ you, leave the thing to “the nameless crypt of its mutism” > it knows (how) to keep quiet
C.linkedContent: Derrida means not to touch anything, leave the thing alone, alone w/ you, leave the thing to “the nameless crypt of its mutism” > it knows (how) to keep quiet

C.content: date as place of crypt, stands in for it, only one that remains; why do I date? throw of a die: no one will know what was lived on the date (what was taken away), save (fors) the heart
C.linkedContent: date as place of crypt, stands in for it, only one that remains; why do I date? throw of a die: no one will know what was lived on the date (what was taken away), save (fors) the heart

LI.linkedContent: “classical concept” as target: a tortuous, complex strategy > exploit target against itself by discovering it to be “basis” of an operation directed against itself, or discovering “in it” the cryptic reserve of something utterly different

ATM.linkedContent: bottomless crypt gives one to read for a lapse above her body that decomposes on analysis

AD.content: idiom, ambiguous chance, shibboleth of the threshold, preliminary chance of hospitality (i.e. French language)
AD.linkedContent: idiom, ambiguous chance, shibboleth of the threshold, preliminary chance of hospitality (i.e. French language)
